page.title: 07LOCAL NEWS,REIGATE/REDHILL
page.content: In May, the local newspaper gave coverage to the fortieth anniversary of{V.E.Day}with{reminiscences}of a lady who was eleven in 1945 & also the memories of a former Japanese prisoner of war. There was unfavourable comment about the sudden closure of roads in Reigate in order to check the safety of the {caves }beneath the town's centre. In the advertising section many pages were devoted to the sale of {properties. Prices}asked for 4 bedroomed, 2 bathroomed houses were in excess of Â£130,000; whereas a 2 bedroomed flat would sell at around Â£40,000. The correspondence columns included opinions about Donyngs-the{new leisure {centre}at Redhill. Both the cost-Â£4 million-& the architecture were severely criticised.
